metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5117 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Use of an uninitialized value in Skia in Google Chrome prior to61.0.3163.79 for Linux and Windows allowed a remote attacker to obtainpotentially sensitive information from process memory via a crafted HTMLpage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5117` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
chromium-browser-l10n - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
chromium-chromedriver - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378').
